questions.question: Accumulator stored fluid pressure purpose? (SELECT TWO)

options.B: Enable BOP closure on power failure

questions.explanation: Pre-charged accumulators: Fast closure (A) without waiting for pumps, and backup power (B) for emergency. Storage (C) is function, not purpose. Choke is separate system.

questions.question: Accumulator bottles pre-charged with nitrogen?
questions.explanation: Nitrogen provides the stored energy. Hydraulic fluid compresses the N2; when released, N2 expands and pushes fluid to BOPs.

questions.question: High-low bypass valve - when does full accumulator pressure apply?
questions.explanation: High-low bypass sends full 3000 psi to rams and HCR (hydraulic connector release). Annular always gets regulated pressure to prevent element damage.

questions.question: API STD 53 requirement for fluid reservoir?
questions.explanation: Reservoir must hold twice the stored volume to account for fluid returning from BOP functions plus reserve.

questions.question: API STD 53 charging system requirement?
questions.explanation: Two INDEPENDENT charging systems required—typically one electric, one air-powered. Redundancy ensures recharge capability if one fails.

questions.question: API STD 53 - recharge pump start pressure?
questions.explanation: Pumps auto-start at 90% to maintain near-full pressure. Don't wait until pressure drops significantly.

questions.question: Calculate BOP function volumes: 1 annular, 3 rams, HCR both lines.
questions.explanation: Sum all close volumes: annular + rams + HCR. Each has specified gallons in manufacturer data.

questions.question: Diverter totally shuts in well?
questions.explanation: Diverter DIVERTS flow away from rig floor—doesn't shut in. Used for shallow gas when shutting in would fracture formation.

questions.question: Diverter activation sequence (wind starboard to port)?

options.A: Open starboard vent; close shaker; close diverter
options.B: Close diverter; close shaker; open starboard vent
options.C: Close diverter; open port vent; close shaker
options.D: Open port vent; close shaker; close diverter

questions.explanation: Vent DOWNWIND first (port, since wind is starboard-to-port), then isolate shakers, then close diverter. Sequence: safe vent path → isolate equipment → seal.

questions.question: Annular preventer statements: Seal on open hole? Seal on any item? Reciprocate while closed? Range of operating pressures? Same rubber type always?
questions.explanation: Annulars: seal open hole (yes), most items but not all (kelly, etc.), allow stripping (yes), variable pressure (yes), different elements for H2S, temp (no single type).

questions.question: Weep hole function? (SELECT TWO)
questions.explanation: Weep hole warns of primary seal failure (B) and protects opening chamber from overpressure damage (D). Not for pressure release or general leak indication.

questions.question: Weep hole leaks during weekly test. Action?

options.B: Energise emergency packing; leave if stops

questions.explanation: Weep hole leak = primary seal failure. This is serious—repair immediately. Not normal, not something to leave or work around.

questions.question: Closing ratio definition?

options.B: Hydraulic pressure ratio to specific wellbore pressure
options.C: Operating pressure to open against wellbore
options.D: Packer area vs piston rod area

questions.explanation: Closing ratio = hydraulic pressure needed to close against given wellbore pressure. e.g., 7:1 means 100 psi hydraulic holds 700 psi wellbore.

questions.question: API STD 53 recommended closing times: 13 5/8" 15K Ram? 21 1/4" 5K Annular? 16 3/8" 5K Annular? 11" 5K Ram?
questions.explanation: API specifies maximum closing times. Larger annulars (21 1/4") allowed more time. Most rams and smaller annulars = 30 seconds.

questions.question: Choke main function?
questions.explanation: Choke maintains backpressure during kill operations to keep BHP constant while circulating out influx.

questions.question: Why two chokes in manifold?
questions.explanation: Redundancy. If one choke washes out or plugs during kill, switch to the other without stopping operations.

questions.question: RAM BOP: RWP 15000, Ratio 6.8:1 close / 3:1 open, 3000 psi accumulator. Min close pressure at max wellbore? Max opening pressure?
questions.explanation: Close: 15000/6.8 = 2206 psi minimum to hold against rated wellbore. Open: 3000 × 3 = 9000 psi (limited by system, not physics).

questions.question: Cameron 13 5/8" 10K RWP, Ratio 7:1, 200 psi friction. Minimum close pressure at 10K wellbore?
questions.explanation: 10000/7 = 1428 psi to overcome wellbore + 200 psi friction = 1628 psi. Or: 10000/7 + friction consideration.
